course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Design of Logistics and Manufacturing Systems
course.description: Facility location, process and material flow analysis, space allocation and plant layout, computerized layout planning, material handling equipment, material handling system design.

reviews.author: 饮茶
reviews.comment_content:
Cover Following Topics:
1 Introduction to Facilities Planning
2 Facility Location Models
3 Machine Layout & Group Technology
4 Flow & Activity Relationships
5 Layout Design
6 Warehouse Operations & layout
7 Product, Process and Schedule Design

* Include one section of company visit, which is a meaningful tour
reviews.comment_teaching:
The content has been arranged in a reasonable way, providing enough examples/sample questions for each concept/method.

Prof. QIU is patient and has a good delivery in the lecture, and the tutorial(lab) instruction is also clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework + Lab reports 15%
Project 15%
Participation(in short quiz after class) 5%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final Exam 40%

Pretty well for me. You can get an A range if you understand the lecture content. The questions given in the exam are reasonable and similar questions are usually covered in lectures.
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework+Lab reports: 4HW and 6 Lab. HW takes around 30-60 min if you have fully understood the lecture content. Lab reports submit the code (Excle+Facility Planning Software) result.

Project (Group): Presentation+Report, analyzing an existing facility layout and giving advice. The workload is mainly on data collection and can significantly reduce if you have a reliable team. (higher workload if working alone)

Participation/Quiz: Prof.QIU will tell us, 'We have a quiz today' at the beginning of a lecture. The quiz usually includes one question, whose concept has been explained in the last few lectures.

Mid-term exam 25%: cover Topic 1-4 + 5.1
Final Exam 40%: cover Topic 2,5,6,7
